title: Wil Koch
name: William Koch
bio: Hello world! My name is Wil Koch (pronounced 'cook') and I am a third year PhD student at Boston University advised by Azer Bestavros. I study autonomous malware (a.k.a. bots) and developing defenses for their attacks. Before returning to academia I was involved in a few start-ups and worked as a software engineer. I enjoy writing code and working on software projects. When I'm not behind a screen, depending on the season I'll be out snowboarding, surfing or getting lost somewhere in the woods.

industry.description: Co-founder and CEO of mobile application to augment the world.

Lead software engineer on software components in the Sikorsky CH-53K Aircraft's Integrated Support System (ISS). Designed and implemented continuous integration system. Responsible for integration between third-party vendors.

projects.title: Android Leak Hunter
projects.description: Automated large scale analysis of Android applications to identify potential information leakages through network connections

projects.title: DeviceFP
projects.description: Fingerprint your Android device to identify information leakages and properties that can be used to uniquely identify your device.

projects.title: CloudSwitch
projects.description: Android application to easily toggle the state of your virtual machines by the push of a button. Allows the user to save money by only turning them on when needed.
